Literature Review: The development of antibodies that can effectively counteract the complex strategies employed by pathogens to evade the immune system has become a pressing area of research. With the increasing burden of infectious diseases, there is a growing need for novel approaches to immunotherapy. Antibody engineering has emerged as a promising strategy to design antibodies that can outsmart pathogens and provide long-term protection against infectious diseases. In this review, we will discuss the general strategies for designing antibodies resistant to specific pathogen defense mechanisms, including access to conserved neutralizing epitopes, Fc engineering, and bispecific antibody design.
